title: Interactive Agent Script Navigator - Frontend Implementation

requirements.summary: Create interactive decision tree interface for Verisure retention script navigation
acceptanceCriteria: Agents can click through the script structure from start to end
Navigation buttons clearly show available customer response options
Current position in the conversation flow is visually indicated

file_operations.description: Set up main application structure with state management for tracking current script position and navigation history. Implement container for the interactive script navigator component.
Create the main script navigator component that manages the overall decision tree state, handles navigation between script sections, and renders the current view based on the navigation path.

Define TypeScript interfaces for the script data structure including ScriptNode, NavigationPath, ScriptSection types that represent the hierarchical decision tree with diagnosis questions, qualifying questions, reframing points, solutions, and closing questions.

requirements.summary: Implement initial diagnosis screen with three main category options
acceptanceCriteria: Main diagnosis question is displayed prominently at the start
Three primary category buttons are clearly labeled and clickable
Clicking a category navigates to the corresponding refinement screen

file_operations.description: Create the initial diagnosis screen component displaying the question 'Waarin zijn we u tekortgekomen? Gaat het om het financiële aspect, bent u ergens ontevreden over, of gebruikt u het systeem simpelweg niet?' with three prominent navigation buttons labeled FINA (Financial), UNHAPPY (Dissatisfied), and NO USE (No usage). Each button triggers navigation to the corresponding refinement screen.

Create the complete script data structure containing all Dutch text content for the entire retention script including the initial diagnosis question and all category paths. Structure the data hierarchically to support up to 4 levels of navigation depth.

requirements.summary: Build FINA branch with financial refinement question and three subcategory paths
acceptanceCriteria: Financial refinement question displays when FINA is selected
Three subcategory buttons navigate to detailed script sections
Back navigation allows return to main diagnosis

file_operations.description: Create reusable refinement screen component that displays refinement questions with subcategory navigation buttons. For FINA category, display 'Mag ik u vragen: vindt u het bedrag de investering niet meer waard, kiest u ervoor om uw prioriteiten anders te leggen, of zit u in een situatie waarin elke euro echt telt?' with buttons for Waarde mismatch, Prioriteitsconflict, and Financiële nood. Include back navigation functionality.
Add complete FINA branch data including the refinement question and three subcategory definitions (Waarde mismatch, Prioriteitsconflict, Financiële nood) with their corresponding navigation paths.

requirements.summary: Implement detailed script view for Waarde mismatch scenario (1.1)
acceptanceCriteria: All script sections (diagnosis, 3 questions, reframing, solution, closing) are displayed
Text is presented in readable format with proper spacing
Agent can copy text or navigate to other scenarios

file_operations.description: Create detailed script view component that displays all sections of a script scenario including diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, complete solution text, and closing question. Use clear visual hierarchy with proper spacing and typography to distinguish each section. Make text selectable for copying.

Add complete content for Waarde mismatch (1.1) scenario including diagnosis question, all three qualifying questions, reframing points, solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the Dutch script.

requirements.summary: Implement detailed script view for Prioriteitsconflict scenario (1.2)
acceptanceCriteria: All script sections are displayed with proper formatting
Content matches the provided Priority conflict scenario exactly
Navigation allows movement between scenarios

file_operations.description: Add complete content for Prioriteitsconflict (1.2) scenario including diagnosis question, all three qualifying questions, reframing points, solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the Dutch script.

requirements.summary: Implement detailed script view for Financiële nood scenario (1.3)
acceptanceCriteria: All script sections are displayed accurately
Financial hardship scenario content is complete
Agent can navigate between all financial subcategories

file_operations.description: Add complete content for Financiële nood (1.3) scenario including diagnosis question, all three qualifying questions, reframing points, solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the Dutch script.

requirements.summary: Build UNHAPPY branch with dissatisfaction refinement question and three subcategories
acceptanceCriteria: Unhappy refinement question displays when UNHAPPY is selected

file_operations.description: Add complete UNHAPPY branch data including the refinement question 'Waar bent u precies ontevreden over: de prijs, onze service of het systeem zelf?' and three subcategory definitions (PRICE, SERVICE, SYSTEEM) with their corresponding navigation paths.

requirements.summary: Implement detailed script views for all three UNHAPPY subcategories (Price, Service, System)
acceptanceCriteria: All three Unhappy scenarios display complete script content

file_operations.description: Add complete content for all three UNHAPPY subcategories: 2.1 PRICE, 2.2 SERVICE, and 2.3 SYSTEEM. Each includes diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the Dutch script.

Each subcategory contains diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the Dutch script.

Each subcategory contains diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the Dutch script.

requirements.summary: Add breadcrumb navigation system showing current path through script hierarchy
acceptanceCriteria: Breadcrumb trail is visible at all levels of the script
Each breadcrumb level is clickable and navigates to that section
Current position is clearly indicated in the breadcrumb

file_operations.description: Create breadcrumb navigation component that displays the current path through the script hierarchy (e.g., START > NO USE > Situatie is veranderd > Ik ben vaker thuis). Each level is clickable and navigates back to that section. Highlight the current position visually to help agents track their location in the script.
Integrate the Breadcrumb component into the ScriptNavigator, passing the current navigation path and handling breadcrumb click navigation to update the current script position.

requirements.summary: Display all Dutch text content exactly as provided preserving formatting
acceptanceCriteria: All script text appears in Dutch as provided
Formatting matches the original structure
No text is truncated or altered

file_operations.description: Verify all Dutch text content is included exactly as provided in the original script, preserving all formatting, quotes, bullet points, and special characters. Ensure no text is truncated or altered throughout the entire script hierarchy.
Ensure the ScriptDetailView component preserves all text formatting from the data structure including line breaks, bullet points, quotes, and special characters when rendering Dutch content.

requirements.summary: Implement clear visual design distinguishing script sections for quick scanning
acceptanceCriteria: Script sections are visually distinct and easy to scan
Design supports quick reading during calls
Interface feels professional and calm, suitable for customer service context

file_operations.description: Apply visual design that clearly distinguishes between script sections (diagnosis, questions, reframing, solution, closing) using typography hierarchy, spacing, and subtle background colors. Optimize for quick scanning during live calls with a professional, calm design suitable for customer service.

Add global styling for the script navigator interface with a professional color palette suitable for customer service. Define typography styles that support quick readability during calls and ensure sufficient spacing between elements for easy scanning.
Apply consistent visual styling to the diagnosis screen with clear, prominent buttons and professional design that matches the overall interface aesthetic.
Apply consistent visual styling to refinement screens ensuring navigation buttons are clear and the layout supports quick decision-making during customer interactions.
